meanings.definition: A tall, pointed structure on top of a building, typically a church.
meanings.sent1: The steeples of the church reached high into the sky.
meanings.sent2: The bells in the steeples rang out across the town.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the steeples, singing a morning chorus.
meanings.sent4: The steeples stood like guardians over the peaceful village.
meanings.sent5: Against the sunset, the steeples looked like fingers pointing towards the heavens.

meanings.definition: To decorate or furnish with a steeple or steeples.
meanings.sent1: The carpenters worked hard to steeple the new church.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to steeples her garden with colorful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to steeples their sandcastle with seashells.
meanings.sent4: The chef would steeples the cake with delicate icing designs.
meanings.sent5: He planned to steeples the room with elegant drapes and curtains.
